result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven S McCurdy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse Co Clerk of Court

miscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol, drugs or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician

No bars or taverns
.

The defendant is to go on Monday & sign up for benefits

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

The Court may grant an early discharge after 12 months of probation following the successful completion of the conditions of this Court Order, adherence to the rules of supervision and upon the recommendation of the PO

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes: The defendant is to be released on 9-29-14 at 9:00 a.m.

supervisions.notes:
Can be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Support Services

If defendant is successful after 5 months, the defendant can come back to Court and the Court may drop one sentence

Unpaid financial obligation to be converted to a Civil Judgment
.

From: JSS Re: per Gundersen Lutheran Social services def has stage III wound on ankle, he is on non-weight bearing restriction for the next 6 wks which means he will need to be admitted into an assisted living facility for the next 6 wks to recover.
TWB: any warrant may be quashed. He may be off EMP pending recovery.

JS Sentence Violation - ORDER TO DETAIN signed by TWB
Visions 7/9/15 SB
Revoked- sentenced to CJ
Amendment to JOC:  CRT costs/fees are converted to a Civil Judgment -signed by TWB
Amended PSI - pgs 3, 5 & 10

4 pm Def in court w/ Atty Christopher M. Zachar.  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentence after revocation in 14CF-556.  Parties have reviewed the PSI in 15CF-19.  Zachar comments on PSI.  Hynek asks for 1 year CJ and that it run concurrent with the 2014 case.  Supervision in the communty wouldn't do him any good.  Asks for part of the sentence to be w/o release.  Zachar:  All of these counts stem from the same incident.  Mr. McCurdy ack. that he was high.  He's a danger primarily to himself.  Sites personal history.  He's never received formal AODA treatment.  Asks the court to go along with the recommendation and allow em.  McCurdy comments.  Court comments.
SENTENCES:  14CF-556 - 8 mos CJ w/154 days credit; 15CF-19 Count 2 - 2 mos CJ consecutive to 14CF-556; Count 3 - 2 mos CJ consecutive to Count 2; Count 5 - 4 mos CJ consecutive to Count 3.  Can be served on em.  If he's successfull after 5 mos, he can come back and I may drop one sentence.  Outstanding coss and fees in 14CFR-556 are converted to a civil judgment.  CC imposed in 15CF-19 - $25/ mo by 7/15/15.  Appeal rights advised.
Revocation Summary
Chris Zachar
Vincent Rust
PO is Rebecca Johnson

Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed

CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 18 mos w/ conditions:  def to serve 3 days CJ beginning today - to be released on 9-29-14 @ 9am;  AODA & follow-thru;  No alcohol, drugs or cont subs w/o valid prescription;  No bars or taverns;  Def to go on Mon. & sign up for benefits;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  After 12 months of probation have been served successfully, def can come back & ask to terminate probation
Eric Sanford
